sorcer.core.context.model.par

Class Par<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.service.Identity
      • sorcer.core.context.model.par.Par<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<T>, Arg, Evaluation<T>, Identifiable, Invocation<T>, Mappable<T>, Setter

    public class Par<T>
extends Identity
implements Arg, Mappable<T>, Evaluation<T>, Invocation<T>, Setter, Comparable<T>, Serializable
    In service-based modeling, a parameter (for short a par) is a special kind of variable, used in a service context ParModel to refer to one of the pieces of data provided as input to the invokers (subroutines of the context). These pieces of data are called arguments.
    Author:
    Mike Sobolewski
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • putValue

        public T putValue(String path,
         Object value)
           throws ContextException
        Description copied from interface: Mappable
        Maps the specified path to the specified value in this mappable. Neither the path nor the value can be null.

        The value can be retrieved by calling the getValue method with a path that is equal to the original path.

        Specified by:
        putValue in interface Mappable<T>
        Parameters:
        path - the attribute-based path
        value - the new value
        Returns:
        the previous value of the specified path in this mappable, or null if it did not have one
        Throws:
        ContextException
